quiz.text: Find the total interest received by Tarun (Scheme S4 + Scheme S5).
options: Rs 9936
Rs 11936
Rs 10936
Rs 10836
None of these

quiz.text: If Arun invested in Scheme S5, with all given conditions under what Tarun invested then, find the interest received by Arun from scheme S5.
options: Rs 2750
Rs 3080
Rs 2250
Rs 2450
None of these

quiz.text: If Tanvi invested Rs. 50000 at (P/2 + Q – 5) % per annum under compound interest for 3 years, find interest received by Tanvi.
options: Rs 38600
Rs 25600
Rs 32400
Rs 36400
None of these

quiz.text: Find the initial money with Arun, Kabir and Varun together?
options: Rs 76000
Rs 77000
Rs 75000
Rs 74000
None of these

quiz.text: Find the value of 8.5T years.
options: 36 years
32 years
38 years
42 years
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of the money becomes Rs.5580 after 2 years when invested in scheme A which offers simple interest and the same sum of money becomes Rs.6120 after 3 years when invested in scheme B which offers same simple interest. The interest earned by a person is Rs________ if he invested the same money in scheme C which offers compound interest for 2 years at the rate of 10% per annum?
options: Rs 945
Rs 1080
Rs 1145
Rs 1275
None of these

quiz.text: Arun invested Rs. 16800 in a scheme P offered simple interest for 5 years at ___% per annum, thus earning interest of Rs. 10080. If Arun invested 100% more amount in scheme Q than what he invested in scheme P and compound interest earned by Arun from scheme Q is Rs. M  at (__/2 + R)% per annum. If M is ≤ Rs. 10800 then find which of the following can’t be the possible value of (R + 8), R is an integer?
options: 12
15
18
11
14

quiz.text: Compound interest earned on Rs. 8000 at M% per annum after two years is Rs. 2035.2. Find the difference between simple interest and compound interest earned on 50% more sum at (M + 8) % per annum for two years.
options: Rs 540
Rs 480
Rs 600
Rs 800
None of these

quiz.text: Piyush borrowed Rs. 6000 from Harshit at 10% compound interest per annum for 3 years and added some extra money and lent to Ketan at 20% compound interest per annum for 24 months. If Piyush got Rs. 1974 more interest than interest got by Harshit. The extra money added by Piyush is Rs _________?
options: Rs 2995
Rs 3000
Rs 2850
Rs 3560
None of these

quiz.text: A person invested Rs.5000 at ____ percent annual CI for 2 years and after 2 years, he invested the received amount for 3 years at ___ percent SI. The total simple interest amount received by him is Rs.5400. Which of the following value will fill the blanks given in the question in the same order? A: 20 and 25 B: 50 and 16 C: 100 and 9
options: Only A and B
All A, B and C
Only A and C
Only B and C
Only A

quiz.text: Samar invested some amount of money in the share market and stock market. Find the total interest earned by Samar from the Stock market and Share market together.   Statement I: Difference between the compound interest and simple interest earned on Rs. 8000 at (2P – 10) % per annum is Rs. 320. Statement II: Samar invested Rs. 12000 in share market for three years, earning compound interest at (P - 5) % per annum. Statement III: Samar invested Rs. 2560 in the stock market for four years, earning simple interest at (P + 5) % per annum.
options: Statement I and II only
Statement I and III only
Statement II and III only
All three statements together are not sufficient to answer the question
None of these

quiz.text: What is the difference between the amount invested in scheme A and B?   Statement I: Heena invested a total of Rs.7000 in scheme A and scheme B for 3 years and 4 years respectively. Scheme B offers 15% simple interest. Statement II: The scheme A offers 10% compound interest. The sum of interest received from scheme A and B together is Rs.2989.5.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II alone is not sufficient to answer the question
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I alone is not sufficient to answer the question
The data either in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question
The data given in both statements I and II together are not sufficient to answer the question
The data given in both statements I and II together are necessary to answer the question.

quiz.text: Scheme P offered K% rate of interest on compound interest. Find the value of K. Statement I: If the simple interest received on 0.4M sum of money at K/4% per annum for 11 years is 50% of the interest received if M invested in scheme P for 2 years Statement II: N invested in scheme P for 2 years, amounts to Rs. 3600. If 16N/25 invested in scheme Q for 2 years at (K – 10) % per annum compound interest, amounts to Rs. 1936. Statement III:  Difference between compound interest earned on Rs. Z is 1152 for two years and three years, when invested in scheme P.
options: Only I is sufficient to answer the question
Only II is sufficient to answer the question
Only III is sufficient to answer the question
Either I or II is sufficient to answer the question
None of these

quiz.text: Direction:  The following question is accompanied by three statements (I), (II), and (III). You have to determine which statements(s) is/are sufficient/necessary to answer the questions. Find the principal amount. Statement I: The compound interest obtained when a sum is invested at 25% rate for 2 years is Rs. 250 more than the simple interest obtained when the same amount is invested at a 5% rate for 1 year. Statement II: A sum gets two more than its triple when it is invested at 3.5% rate compounded annually. Statement III: The difference of amount on a sum invested at 8% rate compounded annually and semi-annually is Rs. 279.
options: The data in statement I alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement II and statement III alone are not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement I and III is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statement I alone or in statement II alone is sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement III alone is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in all the statements I, II and III is not sufficient to answer the question.
The data in statements I and statement II are sufficient to answer the question, while the data in statement III alone is not sufficient to answer the question.

quiz.text: Find the value of ‘R’ if a certain amount is invested at ‘R’% annual rate of compound interest and the interest amount received after 3 years is Rs 15250.
options: Simple interest amount on the same sum after 4 years at same rate of interest become Rs16000.
Difference between SI and CI on the same sum after 3 years at same rate of interest becomes Rs3250.
Compound interest amount of the same sum after 2 years at same rate of interest becomes Rs9000
Same sum amounts to Rs31250 after 3 years after at same rate of compound interest
Compound interest amount of double the sum after 3 years at same rate of interest becomes Rs30500.

quiz.text: A man invested Rs. 5P in scheme X earning simple interest at (R – 4) % per annum. After 4 years money amounts to Rs. 7.4P. He gives 60% what he invested to his friend, his friends invested this money in scheme Y for 3 years earning compound interest at (R/2 + 7)% per annum. The difference between simple interest and compound interest earned is Rs. 2679.60. Find the money invested in scheme X.
options: Rs 9600
Rs 16000
Rs 12800
Rs 15000
Rs 25000

quiz.text: Out of a sum of Rs. 1900, a part (X) was lent at 12% simple interest and the second part (Y) at 10% compound Interest. The interest on the first part after 3 years is equal to the interest on the second part after 2 years. What is the value of Y – X?
options: 700
500
800
600
900

quiz.text: Arun borrows Rs. (2K + 5000) from bank for three years, paying interest of 12% per annum at simple interest. He spends 40% of amount and rest invested in a scheme for three years, earning 50% compound interest per annum. If difference between total amount to be paid by Arun and earnings of Arun from scheme is Rs. 1300, then find the value of K.
options: 9500
8000
6000
7500
11500

quiz.text: Arun invested Rs. P in scheme X at 20% per annum earning simple interest for three years, Rs. Q in scheme Y at 12% per annum, earning compound interest for 2 years. If he earned compound interest from scheme X and simple interest from scheme Y, then total interest earned by him is Rs. 8240 more compared to the previous case. Find the total investment made by Arun, if the sum invested in scheme X is 40% more than that of scheme Y.
options: Rs 120000
Rs 125000
Rs 135000
Rs 160000
Rs 180000

quiz.text: Karan invested Rs. P in scheme X at 10% per annum earning simple interest for three years, Rs. Q in scheme Y at 15% per annum, earning compound interest for 2 years. If he earned compound interest from scheme X and simple interest from scheme Y, then the total interest earned by him is Rs. 712 more compared to the previous case. Find total investment made by Karan, if sum invested in scheme X is 30% more than that of scheme Y.
options: Rs 87000
Rs 92000
Rs 99500
Rs 105000
Rs 112000

quiz.text: Read the given statement in each of the following questions and compare the quantities on its basis. (Only quantity is to be considered) Quantity I: Difference between CI and SI on a certain sum for 2 years is Rs.160. If CI received on that sum for 2 years is Rs.1760, then find the rate of interest. Quantity II: What is the value of ‘x’ in (x2 – 40x + 384 = 0)?
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II (or) relationship can't be determined

quiz.text: Difference between CI and SI on a certain sum at 12% rate of interest for 2 years is Rs.7392 less than the sum. Quantity I: Find the 25% part of CI received on the same sum at same rate of interest after 2 years? Quantity II: Find the difference between CI and SI after 3 years on the same sum at same rate of interest? Quantity III: A and B started a business by investing in the ratio of 4: 3. After 10 months A withdrew his whole capital and B invested 11(1/9) % more. If at the end of 1-year profit received by B is Rs.3850, then find the difference between profit shares of A and B?
options: Quantity I < Quantity II < Quantity III
Quantity I = Quantity III < Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity III > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity III = Quantity II
Quantity I > Quantity III > Quantity II

quiz.text: In the following question, two statements are numbered as A and B. On solving these statements, we get quantities A and B respectively. Solve both quantities and choose the correct option. Quantity I: What is the compound interest available on principal amount of Rs 20,000 at the rate of 12.5% per annum for two years? Quantity II: If an amount of Rs 18,000 is divided in ratio of 5 : 4 wherein larger part is kept at simple interest of 20% for 3 years and smaller part at compound interest of 10% for two years. What is the interest earned by the person at the end of two years?
options: Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II
Quantity I > Quantity II

quiz.text: In the following question, two statements are numbered as A and B. On solving these statements, we get quantities A and B respectively. Solve both quantities and choose the correct option. Quantity A: If the principal of Rs. 15,000 is invested at 10% per annum compound interest for 2 years and 4 months. Find the amount. Quantity B: Rs. 18750
options: Quantity A ≥ Quantity B
Quantity A ≤ Quantity B
Quantity A < Quantity B
Quantity A > Quantity B
Quantity A = Quantity B or No relation

quiz.text: In the following question, two statements are numbered as A and B. On solving these statements, we get quantities A and B respectively. Solve both quantities and choose the correct option. Quantity I: A invests Rs 2500 and Rs 3000 for 2 years on simple interest at the rate of 15% and 20% respectively. After 2 years, he invested the total amount at a certain rate at compound interest annually for one year. The difference of interest earned after 2 years and after one year is Rs 1205, then find the rate of interest at which he invested that amount at compound interest. Quantity II: 11%
options: Quantity I ≥ Quantity II
Quantity I ≤ Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation
